intro: Diarrhena setacea, commonly known as the hairy diurnal orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, grassy habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Diarrhena setacea is primarily pollinated by insects, and its flowering period occurs during the warmer months of the year.
